citation.article-title: Nitrospira marina gen.nov., sp. nov.: a chemolithotrophic nitrite-oxidizing bacterium

p.s: Description of Nitrospira marina sp. nov.
Nitrospira marina (ma.ri'na. L. fem. adj. marina of the sea, marine)
Comma-shaped cells are 0.3 to 0.4 μm in diameter and 1.5 to 1.75 μm in length.
Helical cells are also 0.3-0.4 μm in diameter and may contain from 1 to 12 turns with an amplitude of 0.8 to 1.0 μm.
In enrichment cultures cells frequently occur in tight clumps referred to as cysts.
Obligate chemolithotrophs that oxidize nitrite to nitrate.
Mixotrophic conditions with nitrite, yeast extract, peptone and either glycerol or pyruvate enhance growth.
This species is obligately marine requiring elevated concentrations of NaCl and Mg2+ and Ca2+ for growth.
Optimum growth at 20-30°C and pH of 7.6-8.0.
Contains cytochromes of the b and c types.
Cytochrome of the a-type is missing.
Habitat - marine sediments and water column.
